availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, attorney. Versailles native. Married to Lucy R. Short Kinkead in 1855. Father of Elizabeth Kinkead, Peyton S. Kinkead, Robert C. Kinkead, Mary C. Kinkead, Annie L. Kinkead, and Charles Kinkead. Served as midshipman in the United States Navy. Practiced in partnership with John W. Barr and later formed a firm with his son Robert.

bibl.p: “Aged Lawyer Dead: Joseph B. Kinkead,” Courier-Journal (Louisville, Ky.), April 5, 1892, p. 6. Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, ED 128, p. 421.
